page.title: 17CRUWYS MORCHARD ARTS & CRAFT
page.content: The arts are kept alive by experts in painting, drawing, pressed-flower pictures and decorated egg-shells. Flower arranging is a popular art form. Crafts such as spinning from Devon Closewool fleeces are practised, natural materials such as leaves, beetroot and lichens are used to dye the wool. One man has a kiln in his garden and produces pottery there. Another makes beautiful articles in wood including cases for grandfather clocks. Wine is made from wild and garden produce. Bee-keeping is absorbing and rewarding. Our blacksmith combines his talent for free-hand design with mastery in wrought-iron work to create a range of objects from candlesticks to gates. Cookery and cake-icing with knitting, sewing, canvas-work and patchwork are skilled crafts here.
